intro: Discomela atrorubens, commonly known as the red-spotted antplant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of red and yellow. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators. The leaves are also used in traditional medicine in some indigenous communities.
